author: {'steamid': '76561198950849945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 28, 'playtime_at_review': 2048, 'last_played': 1712110321}
review:
This is a game from my childhood. I played this game all the time when i was little, and i had a blast.
but now, i think its a good simulator game. theres many different things ytou can do in the game, but alot ofd the textures for various tanks and vehicles are missing, such as the m4a3e2, stug, hetzer, and many other vehicles. there is a bug where you will be invincible in the instant action and free flight missions, even with the option disabled. The mission editor as the ground glitch all the time, and takes a while to learn how it works. but despite these complaints, i still have fun with this game. my imagination still takes hold every time i play, and i often have more fun playing this than warthunder. i do seriously hope that this game gets an update, and it fixes all of these problems.

review:
Ich hatte das erste Warbirds Spiel in den späten 1990ern bzw frühen 2000ern gekauft, damals noch als CD Version.

War schon damals ein tolles Spiel da so ziemlich alles kaputt gehen konnte was kaputt gehen kann^^. 

Inzwischen ist die Grafik und die Funktion zum damaligen Original allerdings schon stark fortgeschritten. Leider aber scheinen für bestimmte Online Funktionen extra Gebühren fällig zu sein. 

Aber es macht trotzdem total viel Spaß :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198057118823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1559336234}
review:
Whoa!  What a total waste of $15!  I played this on-line years ago and, at the time, was pretty good.  One would have thought it would have been updated as time passed.  One would have been wrong!  Graphics are ancient, interface is as difficult as it was 10 years ago, and the program will not totally recognize my VKB Joystick.  Which is why I have only logged 0.2 hours played... I couldn't get past programming the joystick.  Hey guys... flying using the keyboard or mouse when away back in the 1990's, didn't it?

And yes... if you want to play on line, it costs a monthly fee.

I wish I had read the reviews first before parting with my money.  But I just had memories of flying with the old squadron and was hoping for a similar experience.

I also wish Steam would check out some of these losers and not offer them...  It's games like this that make Steam look bad.

Bottom line is you should really read the reviews first and avoid this one.

review:
Man merkt dem Spiel an, wie alt es ist, was nicht unbedingt stören würde, wenn da nicht der Preis von 14.99€ wäre. Für das Spiel, so wie es da ist? Ernsthaft ? xD   Ich hab es mit 90% Rabatt Coupon gekauft und mehr ist es auch nicht wert.  Der Multiplayer ist eigentlich tot, was sicher am Alter liegt und an den Alternativen die man hat. Grafik bewerte ich nicht, weil es denke ich wichtigeres gibt

Die Steuerung ist sehr gewöhnungsbedürftig und Luftkämpfe mit der Maussteuerung? Naja viel Glück xD.   Ansonsten lief es bei mir ohne Probleme. 

Werd ich es wieder spielen? Nein.  

Schlecht geb ich eigentlich nur wegen dem Shop- Preis, der ist nicht gerechtfertigt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1496103614}
review:
Tags: Multiplayer Based
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Subscription based MMO that has you roleplay a soldier who can walk around bases and enter vehicles. No one plays servers are deserted.

Review: Menus took forever to load on a really recent machine. Graphics look like mid nineties abandonware. Loading controller defaults did not allow me to actually drive the jeep around. Yeah... because thats a combat aviation game but every time I go in a single player or multiplayer game I am dumped in jeep that I get to drive pointlessly around textureless, empty, barebones military bases. My country was called Red Country. All online modes were solo only except one mode with one server for 10 players. It involved going into instances around the map and supposedly capturing stuff to flip it to your team. The map was perfectly evenly divided between both the teams so I can safely assume nobody captured anything in forever. I tried loading the game again to see if I could get in a plane in single player and the intro music looped 9 times until I tried to tab out and it decided to work. It wanted my email to spam me offers. Buying this game gives you one month with all vehicles unlocked after which you have to pay a fee. Since I could not get out of the JEEP I am not interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969081524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1463820939}
review:
WarBirds - World War II Combat Aviation:

Warning: This game is not for the amatuer / average gamer

This game was developed quite some years ago and was ahead of itself for what it offered. It has been updated and now out on steam.
The game is air combat flight simulator with a very realistic feel and control. After playing the steam version it still feels the same as the old school versions, very hard to learn and I suggest you def' want to get a joystick to help fly.. trust me the keyboard and mouse does not cut it.

Pros: 
~ A good mix of content
~ Realistic controls
~ Flight sim buffs im sure will be happy
~ Dogfights with computers or other people in multiplayer

Cons:
~ Graphics and sound are a little outdated
~ I wish it was easier to learn , this is not for the average gamer
~ I had trouble with this and Windows 8.1 and 10{Windows 7 worked perfect}

Overall: 6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198200424722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1597092201}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972125021', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1462315407}
review:
As one who has played this game on and off for close to 20 years,  this is THE classic WW2 online flight sim.  If you want realistic flight models, an opportunity to fly in historical events run by the community and supported by the publisher, and a mature community, then this is for you.

Most of the negative reviews will be for the graphics and to an extent the difficulty of the flight models.  It takes a little time to learn how to fly effectively, but the payoff is that you are getting as close as it gets to what it might feel like to have flown one of these planes into action in WWII.  Great community of people, good trainers, and most of the all, the weekly S3 series is immersive and REAL.  Want to experience what it was like to escort B17's deep into Germany against the Luftwaffe, where you are constantly looking over your shoulder wonder if those dots on your high 6 are 190's?  This is it!  The rush of making a clean kill in these series is as good as it gets!

I think the game needs a graphics update, and some work on gameplay, but if realism, immersion, and a great mature community are important, then this has it in spades.

Great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062548727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1455423932}
review:
Can't understand what the attraction is. Sub par graphics (should be called Warbirds 1996), sub par gameplay - you'd have to be autistic to enjoy this - I think that explains it. Only played an hour and there's NOTHING that would make me spend another minute in it. It's not bad, it's just no good. It's like some 13 year old novice coder saw Il-2 and said "I can do better". And didn't. Might be worth $5, it aint worth $15.

Avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984960211', 'num_games_owned': 1212, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1450485105}
review:
MMO subscription pricing for a game with an up front fee.

"While WarBirds Online is free, IENT is a business, so of course there are limitations. During the first month online you have complete access to all features at no charge. After the first month, you can still play free, but you are limited to an early war plane set, which varies from arena to arena. To access the full set of all aircraft in all arenas, Steam players can purchase day, week or month passes, which range from $2.99 to $15.95. If you just want to play in a specific event on a specific day, the Day Pass is best for you. If you want to play with the best planes, against the best players, whenever you want, the Month Pass is your best choice."

Recommend you do not buy. Aces high is essentially a more populated version of the same thing with a sub, but no up front fee. I'll admit that the flight model, damage model and graphics are better here. Not ok at all that they charge for the base game if they're going for subscriptions. Feels greedy.

EDIT 1 2015/12/19: Apparently with steam you're supposed to get a month of sub with the purchase so the 15 you spend is supposed to cover the first month of online play. The UI advises to create an account after every training, instant action, mouseclick, but if you make a new account it won't link with steam correctly. Still recommend aces high over this one, free to download and play offline or on private servers, subscription for online arena play, higher server populations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122073541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 43751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2444, 'last_played': 1612738221}
review: Highly Recommend this simulation! Been playing it since 2009, finally glad it is on steam. Very realistically structured, in terms of flight models of aircraft and weaponry and load outs. This isnt your typical shoot em up and fly home simulation. A lot of variables to keep you busy, and coming back. Very addictive once you get hang of it. Check in with some squads, and people will help you out :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198155120682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1478038695}
review:
As some others may have mentioned - Warbirds is, at it's heart, an on-line, massive multiplayer, very realistic WWII flight simulation. It has  extensive offline options that can be enjoyed for itself - well worth the price - these are used by members of the on-line community to hone their skills and as a learning center for new players to develope their flying skills. They can be enjoyed for themselves but the real action is head-to-head play online.

It certainly does NOT require continual in-game purchases to upgrade and/or grinding to get into an aircraft that is competitive. From day one - in off-line and on-line play (depending on historical arena timeframes & subscription) all aircraft and loadouts are available. The selection is entirely up to you.

The flight models are as realistic as the WB development team can make them and they are based on actual performance data. Some aircraft are more forgiving than others - just as they were in real life. There is a learning curve as in all flight sims. A joystick will be the preferred controller - you don't need a super pricey model.

And the community is very welcoming and helpful, esp. for new players.  Well worth the investment!

author: {'steamid': '76561198168273530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1443376187}
review: played this for 10 years online. game USED to be a lot of fun. in the last few years, the game has gone downhill. 24 or so year old graphics can't compete with the new games here. sound effects are terrible. ( some of the ground vehicles sound like sewing machines that need oil) short of a couple of bad eggs(all games have them) the people are really great to play with. try it at least,you may like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994436950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1604852166}
review:
(3 years of prior experience before Steam version) 

Right first things first this isn't War Thunder so if you are looking for flashy graphics this isn't the combat sim for you. Where this sim compromises on graphics it makes up for it in its large open area online combat in arenas spaning 100s of square miles full of targets, such as airbases, towns, docks, supply depots and carrier battle groups. The aim is in closing the enemies bases/towns etc. to allow friendy troop transports to paratroop and capture them for your side, with victory being achieved when you control all of the map (though don't expect it in a single day cause as mentioned they are LARGE maps). 

Flying is not to difficult as long you don't stall ('Realistic' flight mode), I recommend using a joystick not a gamepad, and flying the training and offline combat in easy flight mode first in order to get a feel of the 100+ aircraft (all of which are available to fly, none of this unlocking and paying for special types), though I do stress that all online flight is with the 'realistic' flight mode so get the hang of flying with it on before venturing into the online arenas.

The aircraft models are are mixture of realism and the need to allow ease of playability, and I will say straight away to head off the 'they don't fly realisticly' crowd, of course they won't this is a COMPUTER SIMULATION (this is why I put qoutes unquotes Realistic above), as with all sims compromises had to be made in order to have a large number of combat flyable types within a 4gig package ALL READY TO FLY FROM THE GET GO!! 
That being said each aircraft has its own quirks, and you need to know whether the type you are flying is a 'Turn and Burner' Like say the Spitfire and A6M Zero or a 'Boom and Zoomer' like the Bf109 and F4U Corsair, because this will dictate how you use them in combat. Also bombers, you need to know whether you will need a full fuel load or not cause this will dictate whether you would be able to take off or not with that heavy bomb load of yours.

The online community is for the majority freindly and approachabl with great comradeship within the arenas and the different sqauds available to join once you have been flying online a while. Though the number of online players will Vary from day to day and within in the different timezones due to us all spread out over different countries. 
I also recommend getting the free downloadable TeamSpeak com system since this is where all squad voice coms are controlled.

As a note basic online membership is around $13 a month or there abouts (don't qoute me on that) and that gets you unlimited access to the main arena.

I am sure to have forgotten to mention a large number of things but these are what I could remember off the top of my head for the time being.

This is Vulcan member of the 'Doolittle Raiders' signing off and I hope to meet you in the air sometime.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960457662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1646269834}
review: Ive played the older versions of this game for a long time and loved those.  the new 2016 version runs very smoothly and it is a refreshing updated game!  the online play against other real pilots is a fun and exciting experience, especially the coordinated events that have large numbers of people sometimes upwards of 200 people flying missions at one time.  i reccomend this game to any avid WWII flying buffs that enjoy a realistic take on WWII dogfighting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068669707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1431250897}
review:
Sehr klassisches Flug Simulator Spiel. Es gibt mehr Flugzeuge als früher, Z.B. F86, Hawker Typhoon usw. Die Graphik hat sich verstärkt, aber leider bleibt 2001. Die Einstellung sind noch von 2001.  Es gibt wenige Online-Spieler. Nur für Sammler oder Flug Simulator Fan.

Und als Flug Simulator Fan, würde ich IL2 lieber spielen.
